Sep 23, 2019

I. CITY MANAGER'S AGENDA
1. A communication transmitted from Louis A. DePasquale, City Manager, relative to the appointment
of the following Cambridge residents as new members of the Open Data Review Board for a term of
2 years, effective September 23, 2019: Alanna Williams and Jenine Turner-Trauring.
CMA 2019 #252
RESULT:
PLACED ON FILE

2. A communication transmitted from Louis A. DePasquale, City Manager, relative to Awaiting Report
Item Number 19-94, regarding paving prioritization.
CMA 2019 #253
RESULT:
PLACED ON FILE

3. A communication transmitted from Louis A. DePasquale, City Manager, relative to Awaiting Report
Item Numbers 19-70 and 19-98, regarding restoration and clean up of the Jerry's Pond area.
CMA 2019 #254
RESULT:
PLACED ON FILE

4. A communication transmitted from Louis A. DePasquale, City Manager, relative to
recommendations of the Community Preservation Act Committee (CPAC) for FY2020.
CMA 2019 #255
RESULT:
18 ORDER ADOPTED BY ROLL CALL [9-0-0]

YEAS:
Councillor Carlone, Vice Mayor Devereux, Councillor Kelley, Councillor Mallon,
Mayor McGovern, Councillor Siddiqui, Councillor Simmons, Councillor Toomey,
Councillor Zondervan

5. A communication transmitted from Louis A. DePasquale, City Manager, relative to a petition to
amend provisions in Section 22.20, which governs Green Building Requirements, and also applicable
definitions contained in Article 2.000.
CMA 2019 #256
RESULT:
REFERRED TO PLANNING BOARD AND ORDINANCE COMMITTEE FOR
REPORT AND RECOMMENDATION

6. A communication transmitted from Louis A. DePasquale, City Manager, relative to a petition to
amend provisions in Article 5.000 and Article 22.000 pertaining to setback requirements and exterior
building insulation.
CMA 2019 #257
RESULT:
REFERRED TO PLANNING BOARD AND ORDINANCE COMMITTEE FOR
REPORT AND RECOMMENDATION

PAGE 2

Sep 23, 2019

II. CALENDAR

CHARTER RIGHT
1. A communication transmitted from Louis A. DePasquale, City Manager, relative to Awaiting
Report Item Number 19-56, regarding a report on the feasibility of constructing a quick-build
complete streets project to provide separated bike lanes on Massachusetts Avenue in Central
Square, from Sidney Street to Putnam Avenue.
CMA 2019 #246
RESULT:
PLACED ON FILE

ON THE TABLE
2. A communication was received from Anthony I. Wilson, City Clerk, transmitting Part 4 of the
report from Councillor Dennis J. Carlone, Co-Chair and Councillor Craig A. Kelley, Co-Chair of
the Ordinance Committee, for a reconvened public hearing held on September 3, 2019 to continue
discussions on a proposed amendment to the Zoning Ordinance to create an Affordable Housing
Overlay District.
CRT 2019 #65
RESULT:
NO ACTION TAKEN THIS PETITION WILL BE PLACED ON FILE AS
OF SEPTEMBER 30, 2019 PURSUANT TO M.G.L. C. 40A SECTION 5.

UNFINISHED BUSINESS
3. A communication transmitted from Louis A. DePasquale, City Manager, relative to proposed
amendments to the following ordinance: and proposed amendments to Chapter 14.04 of the
Cambridge Municipal Code (the "Fair Housing Ordinance). Fair Housing (passed to a 2nd
reading) AWAITING HOME RULE LEGISLATION-BEFORE PROPOSAL CAN BE
ORDAINED
CMA 2018 #234
RESULT:
NO ACTION TAKEN

Next: 10/7/2019 5:30 PM

4. A communication transmitted from Louis A. DePasquale, City Manager, relative to Awaiting
Report Item Number 18-108, regarding a report on offering early voting in City Council and
School Committee Elections. PENDING RESPONSE FROM LEGISLATURE
CMA 2018 #286
RESULT:
NO ACTION TAKEN

PAGE 3

Next: 10/7/2019 5:30 PM

Sep 23, 2019

5. A communication transmitted from Louis A. DePasquale, City Manager, relative to the proposed
Cannabis Business Permitting Ordinance. ON OR AFTER APRIL 22, 2019 THE QUESTION
COMES ON PASSAGE TO BE ORDAINED
CMA 2019 #86
RESULT:
ORDAINED [7-0-2-0]

YEAS:
Councillor Carlone, Vice Mayor Devereux, Councillor Kelley, Councillor Mallon,
Mayor McGovern, Councillor Siddiqui, Councillor Zondervan

PRESENT:
Councillor Simmons, Councillor Toomey

6. A Zoning Petition has been received from Alexandria Real Estate Equities, Inc. et al proposing a
Grand Junction Pathway Overlay District
APP 2019 #75
RESULT:
PASSED TO A SECOND READING

PAGE 4

Next: 10/7/2019 5:30 PM

Sep 23, 2019

IV. RESOLUTIONS
1. That the City Council go on record congratulating all the honorees of this year’s YWCA Cambridge
“Tribute to Outstanding Women” awards ceremony.
Councillor Simmons and entire membership.
RES 2019 #307
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED AFFIRMATIVE VOTE OF NINE MEMBERS

2. Speedy recovery wishes to Marcia Brathwaite.
Councillor Simmons and entire membership.
RES 2019 #308
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED AFFIRMATIVE VOTE OF NINE MEMBERS

3. Resolution on the Death of Sharon Hamer
Vice Mayor Devereux, Mayor McGovern and entire membership.
RES 2019 #309
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED AFFIRMATIVE VOTE OF NINE MEMBERS

4. Welcoming JR Associates to Cambridge.
Councillor Toomey and entire membership.
RES 2019 #310
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED AFFIRMATIVE VOTE OF NINE MEMBERS

5. Resolution on the death of Mary Ford.
Councillor Toomey and entire membership.
RES 2019 #311
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED AFFIRMATIVE VOTE OF NINE MEMBERS

6. Best wishes to Paddy's on their 9th Annual 5K Cambridge Classic and congratulations on their 85th
Anniversary Celebration on September 29, 2019.
Councillor Toomey, Councillor Simmons and entire membership.
RES 2019 #312
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED AS AMEDED AFFIRMATIVE VOTE OF NINE MEMBERS

7. Congratulations to City Councillor E. Denise Simmons on being honored with the "HistoryMaker
Award" at the 2019 Annual History Project Awards.
Councillor Toomey and entire membership.
RES 2019 #313
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED AFFIRMATIVE VOTE OF NINE MEMBERS

Sep 23, 2019

V. POLICY ORDER AND RESOLUTION LIST
1. That the Executive Assistant to the City Council confer with the Dedication Committee to consider a
request from Peter C. Johnson for a street sign dedication to Asa Brebner for his contributions to the
community of Cambridge musicians.
POR 2019 #308
Vice Mayor Devereux
RESULT:
CHARTER RIGHT EXCERSICED BY COUNCILLOR TOOMEY
Next: 10/7/2019 5:30 PM

2. That the Executive Assistant to the City Council confer with the Dedication Committee to consider
the request from Vice Mayor Devereux for a street sign dedication near 360 Huron Avenue in honor
of Fresh Pond Market and the Najarian family.
POR 2019 #309
Vice Mayor Devereux
RESULT:
CHARTER RIGHT EXCERSICED BY COUNCILLOR TOOMEY
Next: 10/7/2019 5:30 PM

3. That the City Manager is requested to work with the City Clerk’s Office, the Public Information
Office, and the Information Technology Department to identify a suitable location on the City website
to house information regarding the Municipal Code and to track non-zoning legislation and
amendments.
POR 2019 #310
Vice Mayor Devereux, Councillor Siddiqui
RESULT:
CHARTER RIGHT EXCERSICED BY COUNCILLOR TOOMEY
Next: 10/7/2019 5:30 PM

4. Enforcing Non-Smoking in Cambridge Buildings
POR 2019 #311
Mayor McGovern
RESULT:
CHARTER RIGHT EXCERSICED BY COUNCILLOR TOOMEY
Next: 10/7/2019 5:30 PM

5. Renewable Energy for City Buildings
POR 2019 #312
Councillor Carlone
RESULT:
CHARTER RIGHT EXCERSICED BY COUNCILLOR TOOMEY
Next: 10/7/2019 5:30 PM

PAGE 11

Sep 23, 2019

6. Alcoholic beverage permitting in large parks
POR 2019 #313
Vice Mayor Devereux, Councillor Siddiqui, Councillor Kelley
RESULT:
CHARTER RIGHT EXCERSICED BY COUNCILLOR TOOMEY
Next: 10/7/2019 5:30 PM

7. That the City Manager is requested to work with the appropriate departments to ensure that the
redesign of the Harvard Square plaza and its coming renovation be used as an opportunity to further
improve the safety of all crossings in the surrounding area.
POR 2019 #314
Vice Mayor Devereux, Mayor McGovern, Councillor Carlone, Councillor Zondervan
RESULT:
CHARTER RIGHT EXCERSICED BY COUNCILLOR TOOMEY
Next: 10/7/2019 5:30 PM

8. That the City Manager is requested to light up City Hall red for World Dyslexia Awareness Day,
Friday, October 4, 2019, beginning at sundown.
POR 2019 #315
Mayor McGovern
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED AS AMENDED

9. That the City Manager is requested to work with the Department of Human Services and the
Cambridge Public Library system to hire a social worker in the FY2021 budget for the Central Square
Library branch.
POR 2019 #316
Councillor Mallon, Councillor Siddiqui, Mayor McGovern
RESULT:
CHARTER RIGHT EXCERSICED BY COUNCILLOR TOOMEY
Next: 10/7/2019 5:30 PM

10. That the City Manager is requested to work with the Peace Commission and Citizens’ Commission
on Civic Unity to ensure that the Meet Your Neighbor Day event is held at another time of year, in
Spring or Summer, in order to eliminate any appearances of political conflict at Meet Your Neighbor
Day events.
POR 2019 #317
Vice Mayor Devereux
RESULT:
CHARTER RIGHT EXCERSICED BY COUNCILLOR TOOMEY
Next: 10/7/2019 5:30 PM

PAGE 12

Sep 23, 2019

11. Limb Girdle Muscular Dystrophy Awareness Day
POR 2019 #318
Mayor McGovern
RESULT:
NO ACTION TAKEN

Next: 10/7/2019 5:30 PM

12. That the City Manager work with the City Solicitor, the ordinance committee co-chairs and the
Mayor's office to develop criteria and policy goals to guide the City Manager in negotiating Host
Community Agreements with adult use cannabis retail applicants and report back to the Council
POR 2019 #319
Vice Mayor Devereux
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED

PAGE 13

Sep 23, 2019
